medical_history.chief_complaint: Difficulty in walking due to proximal myopathy.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began at age 20 months with difficulty in walking; the proximal myopathy was confirmed at age 3.4 years and took about 7 years to resolve. The patient had normal height for age throughout.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Diagnosed at the age of 20 months with vitamin D-resistant hypophosphatemic rickets; treated with vitamin D and phosphate supplements; developed vitamin D intoxication.
medical_history.family_history: Strong family history of X-linked hypophosphatemic rickets (XLH) including grandfather, mother, two brothers, and two sisters.
